hydro_energy.title: Hydro Energy
hydro_energy.image_alt: This is an image about Hydro Energy
hydro_energy.description: Hydro energy, or hydroelectric power, is a renewable energy source that uses the movement of water to generate electricity. It is one of the most widely used renewable energy sources worldwide.

steps.water_flow: Water Flow - A dam or river channels water towards turbines.
steps.turbine_rotation: Turbine Rotation - The force of moving water spins the turbines.
steps.electricity_generation: Electricity Generation - The turbines power a generator, converting kinetic energy into electrical energy.

list.ecosystem_impact: ❌ Can impact ecosystems and fish migration

wind_energy.title: Wind Energy
wind_energy.image_alt: This is an image about Wind Energy
wind_energy.description: Wind energy is a renewable energy source that converts the kinetic energy of the wind into electricity using wind turbines.

steps.wind_blows: Wind Blows - The wind turns the blades of a wind turbine.
steps.rotor_rotation: Rotation of the Rotor - The blades are connected to a rotor, which spins a generator.
steps.electricity_generation: Electricity Generation - The generator converts mechanical energy into electrical energy.

list.versatile: ✅ Can be installed on land or offshore

list.variable_wind: ❌ Wind speed is variable and unpredictable
list.wildlife_impact: ❌ Can impact bird and bat populations
list.space_requirement: ❌ Requires large open spaces for optimal efficiency

solar_energy.title: Solar Energy
solar_energy.image_alt: This is an image about Solar Energy
solar_energy.description: Solar energy is a renewable energy source that harnesses sunlight to generate electricity and heat. It is one of the most widely available and sustainable energy sources on Earth

steps.capture_sunlight: Solar Panels Capture Sunlight - Photovoltaic (PV) cells convert sunlight into electricity.
steps.conversion_power: Conversion to Usable Power - An inverter converts the generated direct current (DC) into alternating current (AC) for home or industrial use.
steps.storage: Storage (Optional) - Batteries can store excess energy for nighttime or cloudy days.

list.pv: Solar Photovoltaic (PV) - Converts sunlight directly into electricity using solar panels.
list.thermal: Solar Thermal Energy - Uses the sun’s heat to warm water or air for residential and industrial use.
list.csp: Concentrated Solar Power (CSP) - Uses mirrors or lenses to focus sunlight and generate high temperatures for electricity production.

list.sunlight_dependency: ❌ Energy production depends on sunlight availability
list.space_requirement: ❌ Requires large space for large-scale installations

solar_energy.conclusion: Solar energy is widely used for homes, businesses, and large power plants.

biofuel_energy.title: Biofuel Energy
biofuel_energy.image_alt: This is an image about Biofuel Energy
biofuel_energy.description: Biofuel energy is a renewable energy source derived from organic materials, such as plants, agricultural waste, and animal fats. It can be used for transportation, electricity generation, and heating.

list.bioethanol: Bioethanol - Made from crops like corn, sugarcane, and wheat, often blended with gasoline.
list.biodiesel: Biodiesel - Produced from vegetable oils, animal fats, or algae, used as an alternative to diesel fuel.
list.biogas: Biogas - Generated from organic waste decomposition (e.g., food waste, manure), mainly composed of methane.
list.wood_pellets: Wood and Biomass Pellets - Used for heating and electricity generation.

list.renewable: ✅ Renewable and reduces dependence on fossil fuels
list.waste_reduction: ✅ Can use agricultural waste, reducing waste pollution
list.lower_emissions: ✅ Lower carbon emissions compared to fossil fuels

list.food_competition: ❌ Can compete with food production (e.g., using corn for fuel instead of food)
list.land_usage: ❌ Requires large land areas for crops
list.emissions: ❌ Some biofuels still produce emissions when burned

biofuel_energy.conclusion: Biofuels are widely used in transportation, especially in countries promoting green energy.
